definition: to watch from a height or distance/to survey

sentences.english: A sports organizer lets you see what’s where while keeping equipment in its place.
sentences.chinese: 運動器材存放處讓你對它們的位置一目瞭然。

sentences.english: As far as I can see the whole matter is open-and-shut.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，整件事情是一目瞭然的。

sentences.english: B: Stick with the basics until you know them really well.
sentences.chinese: 堅守住基本原理，直到你瞭然於心。

sentences.english: It should be clear where this path leads.
sentences.chinese: 這條道路通向何方應該是一目瞭然的。

sentences.english: Running state Gao Qingzhi show all the way, be clear at a glance.
sentences.chinese: 運行狀態全程高清直顯，一目瞭然。

sentences.english: Large clear glass display surface, cabinet items at a glance.
sentences.chinese: 大面積清晰玻璃展示面，櫃內物品一目瞭然。

sentences.english: Thisis a notion that general giap well understood, as did the master, sun tzu.
sentences.chinese: 武元甲將軍對此瞭然於心，就像他的老師孫子那樣。

sentences.english: There is little, by contrast, that Mr Hollis does not know about his characters.
sentences.chinese: 相反，赫里斯先生對其筆下人物瞭然於胸。

sentences.english: You drift off to sleep and next thing you know, it sounds like a lumberyard.
sentences.chinese: 你睡着瞭然後被驚醒，那就像木場裏鋸木發出的聲音。

sentences.english: In this period right now, I don't like open-and-shut stuff.
sentences.chinese: 這個階段，我不喜歡一目瞭然的東西。

sentences.english: Historical transition is not an abstract concept but clear to see.
sentences.chinese: 歷史的過渡並非抽象的概念，在此一目瞭然。

sentences.english: Their users already understood the concept of global variables.
sentences.chinese: 他們的用戶對全局變量的概念應該瞭然於胸。

sentences.english: Handset with a simple menu, easy to operate, at a glance.
sentences.chinese: 手持機具有簡潔菜單，操作方便，一目瞭然。

sentences.english: The clear monk sees settle water one eye, don't etc. he to talk and then make decision.
sentences.chinese: 瞭然和尚看了清水一眼，不等他說話就做了決定。

sentences.english: "It's very rare to have a human study where you can see that this caused that, " Wattenberg said.
sentences.chinese: 讓公衆能一目瞭然理解的研究是很少有的。

sentences.english: "This is no clear-cut case, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “這並非是個一目瞭然的案子，”他這樣說。

definition: name and reality/how sth is portrayed and what it is actually like
my limited view (lit. view through a thin tube)/my limited understanding/my opinion (humble)
School of Mind/Neo-Confucian Idealistic School (from Song to mid-Qing times, c. 1000-1750, typified by the teachings of Wang Yangming 王陽明|王阳明[Wang2 Yang2 ming2])
